title: Public Order Police Monitor Darling After Violent Protests
text:
Public Order Police Monitor Darling After Violent Protests

General 2 hours ago (Sep 28, 2019 09:31)

© Reuters.







Public Order Police and other law enforcement agencies are monitoring the situation in Darling along the West Coast. Public Order Police and other law enforcement agencies are monitoring the situation in Darling along the West Coast. Violent demonstrations erupted on Friday after protesters took the streets, demanding better housing and raised issues with regard to electricity tariffs. Police say around 1,500 community members participated in the demonstrations that saw municipal offices, banks, a liquor shop and a pharmacy vandalised. Roads were blocked, and tyres were set alight.







The post Public Order Police Monitor Darling After Violent Protests appeared first on iAfrica.com. The post Public Order Police Monitor Darling After Violent Protests appeared first on iAfrica.com.
